long_description: At only 59g, the Petzl Reverso 4 belay device is 25% lighter than the previous version yet offers the same versatility for belaying and rappelling. Features an intuitive self-braking Reverso mode that allows the lead climber to belay 1 or 2 seconding climbers directly from an anchor point. Clip a carabiner to the carabiner hole and give a tug to easily and gradually release the loaded device while in Reverso mode. Device can be quickly changed from self-braking mode to belaying the leader when climbing long multipitch routes. Reverso 4 provides effective braking on half and twin ropes 7.5mm in diameter and larger; works with 8.9mm and larger single ropes. Hot-forged aluminum construction and smart design make it one of the lightest belays devices available. V-shaped channels with asymmetric grooved sidewalls increase friction on thin ropes for controlled belaying and lowering. Rope-friendly design will not kink ropes regardless of the mode used. Usage diagrams for standard belay and Reverso modes are laser etched onto the Petzl Reverso 4 belay device.
